ca.ualberta.cmput301.t03.user

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cmput301.t03.user.User
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable, Observer, java.lang.Comparable<User>

    public class User
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observable, Observer, java.lang.Comparable<User>
    Model that represents application Users. The current user is a User, and all of his/her Friends are Users too.

    • Constructor Detail

      • User

        public User(java.lang.String username,
            Context context)
        Default constructor for a User. Sets up a datamanager that will handle backing up data to the local cache and Elastic Search. Is called by the PrimaryUser singleton. ex. User u = new User("john12345", getActivity().getApplicationContext());
        Parameters:
        username - A string that uniquely identifies a User.
        context - The current application context.

      • User

        public User(User user,
            Context context)
        Alternate constructor for a User. Should only be used on a freshly Unparceled user, in order to restore context. Use the default constructor in all other cases. ex. User u = Parcels.unwrap(getArguments().getParcelable(ARG_PARAM1)); User u2 = new User(u, getContext());
        Parameters:
        user - An unparceled User; will not be fully initialized.
        context - The current application contest.

    • Method Detail

      • getUsername

        public java.lang.String getUsername()
        Gets the User's username. This will not hit the network. This should be called by the view to display the current username.
        Returns:
        the User's username.

      • getFriends

        public FriendsList getFriends()
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              ServiceNotAvailableException
        Get the User's FriendsList.

        This should be called by the view to display the friends list, and by the controller to get a reference to the friends list model. WARNING: This might hit the network! It must be run asynchronously.

        Returns:
        FriendsList containing the User's Friends.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        ServiceNotAvailableException

      • getProfile

        public UserProfile getProfile()
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              ServiceNotAvailableException
        Get the User's UserProfile.

        This should be called by the view to display the profile, and by the controller to get a reference to the UserProfile model. WARNING: This might hit the network! It must be run asynchronously.

        Returns:
        UserProfile containing the User's profile information.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        ServiceNotAvailableException

      • getInventory

        public Inventory getInventory()
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              ServiceNotAvailableException
        Get the User's Inventory.

        This should be called by the view to display inventory, and by the controller to get a reference to the inventory model. WARNING: This might hit the network! It must be run asynchronously.

        Returns:
        Inventory populated with the User's items.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        ServiceNotAvailableException

      • getTradeList

        public TradeList getTradeList()
                       throws java.io.IOException,
                              ServiceNotAvailableException
        Get TradeList of trades which the User is involved in.

        This should be called by the view to display trades, and by the controller to get a reference to the trades model. WARNING: This might hit the network! It must be run asynchronously.

        Returns:
        TradeList: trades which the user is involved in
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        ServiceNotAvailableException
